group.label: Card payments
group.comment: Configure card payments features like 3D Secure 2, installments, and Click to Pay to optimize your shopperâ€™s experience.

field.label: Show cardholder name field
field.tooltip: When set to Yes, the input field for cardholder name is shown at checkout.
field.comment: If you support Visa or JCB, it is mandatory show the cardholder name field.

field.label: Require cardholder name
field.tooltip: When set to Yes, the shopper is required to provide the cardholder name to pay.
field.comment: If you support Visa or JCB, it is mandatory to collect the cardholder name.

field.label: Enable installments
field.tooltip: When set to Yes, shoppers can pay in installments.

field.label: Installments
field.tooltip:
Configure installment rules for each credit card type. Insert the minimum total payment amount from which you want to offer installments and the number of installments you want to offer for each credit card.
For example: If the minimum amount is 100 and the number of installments is 4x, the shopper will see the 4x option only if the payment total is higher than or equal to 100.

field.label: Send Level 2/3 enhanced scheme data
field.tooltip: When set to Yes, level 2/3 enhanced scheme data will be sent for credit card payments.

field.label: Enable Click to Pay
field.tooltip: When set to Yes, shoppers can pay with Click to Pay with Visa and Mastercard for a faster checkout experience.

field.label: 3D Secure 2 authentication flow
field.comment: Choose your preferred 3D Secure 2 authentication implementation.
field.tooltip: Select Native to perform 3D Secure 2 authentication on your website when available. Native authentication may require modifying your Content Security Policy (CSP) to load the 3D Secure 2 interfaces. If you do not want to adjust your CSP, select Redirect.
